results.title: Nine months in motion
results.brief_description: Exercises for pregnant women. Contents include eating habits, benefits of exercise as explained by a gynaecologist, detailed showcase of several pre-natal exercises and movement techniques and statements by three women who participated in a pre-natal exercise program.

results.title: Nine and a half weeks (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Adrian Lyne, Zelmain King, Isaac King and Anthony Rufus
results.brief_description: This video explores the beginnings of mutual attraction between Elizabeth (Kim Basinger), beautiful and inhibited by love, and John (Mickey Rourke), impressive but strange, and follows the romance through the various stages of seduction, power, submission, rage and death. Their relationship lasts, predictably, 9 1/2 weeks.

results.title: Nimrod
results.brief_description: This is a documentary detailing the evolution of the jet engine. With the use of rare archival footage, we are shown the rapid development of aircraft design, in particular, leading up to and during W.W.II when Germany under Hitler was making dramatic advances with the jet engine. Rated: G

results.title: Just a lady
results.creator_credit: Susan Trow, Kathleen Shannon, Margaret Pettigrew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A photographic journal covering one hundred and fifty years, showing the women of an upper-class Canadian family. Starting with an early immigrant family, the film gradually narrows its focus from yesterday’s women, who lived secure, comfortable lives tied into rigid social patterns, to today’s women and the choices that face them. A search for roots and meaning that is both personal and historical. Photography by Susan Trow and Gilles Tremblay and Richard Moras. Edited by Susan Trow. Music by Sharon Smith. Sound by Bruce Mackay and Alain Clavier.

results.title: Just-a-minute
results.creator_credit: Diane Beaudry and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Just a-minute was a training program organised by Studio D of the National Film Board of Canada in collaboration with the Women’s Program, Department of the Secretary of State. This program gave Canadian women an opportunity to express themselves through the medium of a one minute film clip. Through humour, caricature, or animation, the clips highlight some of the problems or attitudes encountered by women at home and at work. Entertaining to watch, the films do not disguise the pertinence of their contents.

results.title: Just
results.brief_description: In a room above a street, Radiohead play their song, ‘Just’. In the street below, a man lies on the ground, attracting a number of concerned, irritated and worried passers-by. But his condition may be contagious…..

results.title: Jurassic Park [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Gerald Molen, Kathleen Kennedy, Amblin Entertainment and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on Michael Crichton’s best-selling novel of the same name, this is a Spielberg masterpiece of imagination, suspense, science and cinematic magic. On a remote island, a wealthy entrepreneur (Richard Attenborough) secretly creates a theme park featuring living dinosaurs ressurected from extinction through the use of fossilised DNA. Before opening it to the public he invites renowned paleontologist (Sam Neill), paleobotanist (Bruce Dern) and mathematician (Jeff Goldblum) with his two grandchildren, to experience the park - with fatal results. This entertaining film carries a strong message regarding the use of science for material gain and to manipulate life.

results.title: Jupiter odyssey
results.creator_credit: Peter Waller, George Van Valkenburg and United States. National Aeronautics Space Administration
results.brief_description: The story of the 620 million mile journey of Pioneer 10 from Earth to Jupiter. Pioneer 10, launched in 1972, arrived at Jupiter in December 1973. Presents information received from the Pioneer 10 mission, and describes how the information has been used to reprogram Pioneer 11 and redirect it in December 1974 toward a 1979 rendezvous with Saturn. Additionally, a proposal is discussed for another mission, decades in the future, that will land on the satellite to study a solar eclipse of Jupiter.
